text.text: Chapter 5: Taking Action
Welcome to the Taking Action chapter! The activities in this chapter will help you:
- Identify the most powerful actions to build equitable resilience in your community, based on the information you've gathered so far and captured in the
Summary of Hazards, Disasters, Threats and Equity Issues form
- Set up a way forward for implementing these actions
- Reflect on what you have accomplished with your project and think about next steps.

This chapter is about collectively coming up with actions that different organizations, sectors, government agencies, and members of your community can use to help build equitable resilience. If you're not entirely sure what building resilience in an equitable way could entail, check out these
resources on equity

To get started, browse through the activities in the chapter and decide with your core team which ones you'd like to complete, how you will get community input, and how you will customize the activities for your specific needs and goals.
- See Chapter 1 for
of ERB projects with selected chapters and activities
- If you are going to convene a workshop, use the
Example ERB workshop agenda and facilitators guide
and
Example ERB workshop logistics plan
and customize them for planning your workshops.
By the end of the chapter you should walk away with:
- A list of key action areas developed together with members of your community
- Stronger connections with local organizations and residents
- Documentation of what you've done with ERB
- A list of next steps for the core team and others to implement actions
Chapter 5 Outputs:
- What comes next worksheet
- How Might We Statements
- Equity principles
- Actions brainstorming
- Actions short list
- Next steps list
- Documentation of your ERB process
